definitions.definition: Something that is posited; a postulate .

A number format representing a real number consisting of a sign bit , a variable-size "regime" part (which modifies the exponent), up to two exponent bits, and a fraction part, proposed as a more efficient alternative to IEEE 754 floats in AI applications.

main_definition: Something that is posited; a postulate .
secondary_definitions: ( computing ) A number format representing a real number consisting of a sign bit , a variable-size "regime" part (which modifies the exponent), up to two exponent bits, and a fraction part, proposed as a more efficient alternative to IEEE 754 floats in AI applications.
